website_summaries.verdict: Flexible wooden slats combined with a strong steel frame work with your existing queen-size mattress to create a more satisfying sleep experience.
pros: Putting together takes only a short time
Provides plenty of storage space underneath
Users find this a cost-effective and more comfortable solution to solid steel slat frames and a perfect extra bed for a guest room
cons: Make sure slats are put in correctly so that they curve upward or frame will not support mattress correctly

customer_reviews.text: a lot of different parts to put together. when it first came it was missing the hardware but they took care of that but it did take like a week to arrive. the platform itself is nice! it’s too big for my full size mattress but it’ll do.
customer_reviews.author: Kuwabara Family

customer_reviews.title: Using in a spare bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Using this in a spare bedroom so hardly used. I did sleep on the bed with a foam mattress and it was comfortable. But there is no throwing yourself or jumping with this frame because you will either break the cheap wood slats or even the frame. I already knew this when I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: SUNMOONSTAR

customer_reviews.title: My son won't get out of bed now
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6'1 235lb son. He must like it, because I can't get him out of bed. As I was putting it together, I was worried about stability. It's stronger than you'd think. I would advise getting some type of rubber strips to put on before you add a mattress. The finish on the slats makes the mattress slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Safety Hazard
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this bed frame the entire left side of the frame COLLAPSED! Mind you I am not a large person, 5'5" 150lbs. I woke up in the middle of the night to the left side of the frame collapsing because two of the legs came unattached from the metal piece they are "attached" too. I am lucky I wasn't injured and the entire frame has been rendered useless. 0/10 would next buy again. A massive waste of money and a HUGE safety hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Wooden slates bed frame
customer_reviews.text: It looked hard but was easy to assemble, I was working alone so about 2 hrs to do. So far it’s been a good experience
customer_reviews.author: VReynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great product, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product, sturdy, and easy to assemble. I'm using it for an air mattress & it looks/sleeps like an actual bed!!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. A hassle to build but worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and works like a charm. Only 4 stars because it does make the bed feel a little more stiff than a box spring does. All-in-All would still highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Purpleshade13

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Very displeased, everything was messed up in the box. I have bent parts that wont fit together.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is in my bonus room and it is perfect! I love the storage space under it
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a bed from another site, that fell apart. This fit inside that frame perfectly and does the trick. Not very stylish but holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The price was reasonable and the quality was great.
customer_reviews.author: Titeanna
